content.description:
Start on flat ground and go up the face to the left side of an inverted V-shaped roof.  Pull up and rightward across the roof.  Challenging pro leading up to and past the roof.  Then follow easier cracks to the top, staying just right of Fantasy Of Light.

Vogel's JT West listed this as 10b but noted the crux as 10a in its topo drawing.  Bartlett's Lost Horse guide listed it as 10a/b and noted the crux as 10a in its topo drawing.

Possible to go directly up the face to the right side of the inverted V-shaped roof also, but a tad harder.
content.location: Walk off via downscramble to climber's left until touching down into the same notch that accesses Vorpal Sword on that far left end of Atlantis Wall.

content.description:
You can Scramble up and setup TR or climb up Trad.  Goes a lot easier to the left if you go into the OW looking crack and just stem up.

The crux of this of this climb is the start, transitioning from layback to face. You may want to place a pro high as you can in the layback section before leaving the ground.

There is a Tricam stuck in the layback for semi-perma-pro.

You can also use this to setup TR for both Mystic Knight and divine wind.
content.protection: Typical Rack to Thin, might want a big #5 (C4) if you want to use the big giant Off-Widthy Crack on Left. Gets THIN at top.
content.location: Left of Divine Wind. Look behind the bush to a the big layback start.

content.description:
Climbs the featured thin crack to a wide finish in a prominent v-slot. Good gear placements abound and the wide bit at the top is just pulling on creaky jugs.

Downclimb to climber's left and take care, because while easy it's somewhat exposed. Perhaps best to lower or rap off for less-experienced and/or timid climbers.

One star out of five (maybe).
content.location:
Left of center on the Minotaur Wall between

Divine Wind

on the left and

Fantasy of Light

to the right.

climbs.name: Fantasy of Light
climbs.fa: Brian Sillasen,  Todd Gordon & Alan Bartlett, March 1988

content.description:
Start off a boulder from the right or directly (harder) and make bouldery moves (crux) into the start of a nicely featured crack system. Once past the start the route is no harder than 5.7 or so in difficulty.

Downclimb to climber's left and take care, because while easy it's somewhat exposed. Perhaps best to lower or rap off for less-experienced and/or timid climbers.

One star out of five (maybe).
content.location:
Right of center on the Minotaur Wall (which sits in front of the Atlantis Wall), between

Minotaur

on the left and Nittany Lion on the right.

climbs.name: Divine Wind
climbs.fa: Larry LeVoir, Phil Spinelli & Maggie Ross, April 1998, FL  Unknown

content.description: Climb up scrappy face to a horizontal then tackle an intermittent crack/seam which higher opens up to jugs and blocks on the left side of a dark brown headwall. Listed as a top-rope in some guidebooks but it can be lead if willing to run it out on scrappy rock. One star, maybe, out of five.
content.location:
Between Mystic Knights of the Sea and

Minotaur

.
